001package org.biopax.paxtools.controller;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
004import org.biopax.paxtools.model.Model;
005import org.slf4j.Logger;
006import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
007
008import java.util.*;
009
010/**
011 * Utility class to merge multiple biopax models into one. Note that this merger does not preserve
012 * the integrity of the passed models. Target will be a merged model and source will become
013 * unusable.
014 */
015
016public class Merger implements Visitor
017{
018// ------------------------------ FIELDS ------------------------------
019
020        private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(Merger.class);
021
022        private final Traverser traverser;
023
024        private final HashMap<Integer, List<BioPAXElement>> equivalenceMap =
025                        new HashMap<Integer, List<BioPAXElement>>();
026        private final EditorMap map;
027
028        // Keep track of merged elements
029        private final HashSet<BioPAXElement> mergedElements =
030                        new HashSet<BioPAXElement>();
031
032        // Keep track of new elements
033        private final HashSet<BioPAXElement> addedElements = new HashSet<BioPAXElement>();
034
035        // --------------------------- CONSTRUCTORS ---------------------------
036
037        /**
038         * @param map a class to editor map containing the editors for the elements of models to be
039         *            modified.
040         */
041        public Merger(EditorMap map)
042        {
043                this.map = map;
044                traverser = new Traverser(map, this);
045        }
046
047// ------------------------ INTERFACE METHODS ------------------------
048
049        // --------------------- Interface Visitor ---------------------
050
051        /**
052         * Checks whether <em>model</em> contains <em>bpe</em> element, and if it does, then it updates the
053         * value of the equivalent element for <em>bpe</em> by using the specific <em>editor</em>.
054         *
055         * @param domain owner 
056         * @param range property value
057         * @param model  model containing the equivalent element's equivalent
058         * @param editor biopax property editor specific for the value type to be updated
059         */
060        public void visit(BioPAXElement domain, Object range, Model model, PropertyEditor editor)
061        {
062                if (range instanceof BioPAXElement)
063                {
064                        BioPAXElement bpe = (BioPAXElement) range;
065
066                        // do nothing if you already inserted this
067                        if (!model.contains(bpe))
068                        {
069                                //if there is an identical
070                                if (model.getByID(bpe.getUri()) != null)
071                                {
072                                        if (editor.isMultipleCardinality())
073                                        {
074                                                editor.removeValueFromBean(bpe, domain);
075                                        }
076                                        editor.setValueToBean(getIdentical(bpe), domain);
077                                }
078                        }
079                }
080        }
081
082// -------------------------- OTHER METHODS --------------------------
083
084        /**
085         * After a merge is accomplished, this set will contain the merged elements. This is not an
086         * essential method for paxtools functionality, but it may be useful for 3rd party applications.
087         *
088         * @return a hashet of merged elements in the target
089         * @see #merge
090         */
091        public HashSet<BioPAXElement> getMergedElements()
092        {
093                return this.mergedElements;
094        }
095
096        /**
097         * After a merge is accomplished, this set will contain the newly added elements. This is not an
098         * essential method for paxtools functionallity, but it may be useful for 3rd party applications.
099         *
100         * @return a hashet of newly added elements in the target
101         * @see #merge
102         */
103        public HashSet<BioPAXElement> getAddedElements()
104        {
105                return this.addedElements;
106        }
107
108        /**
109         * Merges the <em>source</em> models into <em>target</em> model.
110         *
111         * @param target  model into which merging process will be done
112         * @param sources model(s) that are going to be merged with <em>target</em>
113         */
114        public void merge
115                        (Model target, Model... sources)
116        {
117                // Empty merged and added elements sets
118                mergedElements.clear();
119                addedElements.clear();
120
121                // Fill equivalence map with objects from  target model
122                Set<BioPAXElement> targetElements = target.getObjects();
123                for (BioPAXElement t_bpe : targetElements)
124                {
125                        this.addIntoEquivalanceMap(t_bpe);
126                }
127
128                // Try to insert every biopax element in every source one by one
129                for (Model source : sources)
130                {
131                        Set<BioPAXElement> sourceElements = source.getObjects();
132                        for (BioPAXElement bpe : sourceElements)
133                        {
134                                insert(target, bpe);
135                        }
136                }
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Inserts a BioPAX element into the <em>target</em> model if it does not contain an equivalent;
141         * but if does, than it updates the equivalent using this element's values.
142         *
143         * @param target model into which bpe will be inserted
144         * @param bpe    BioPAX element to be inserted into target
145         */
146        private void insert(Model target, BioPAXElement bpe)
147        {
148                // do nothing if you already inserted this
149                if (!target.contains(bpe))
150                {
151                        //if there is an identical (in fact, "equal") object
152                        BioPAXElement ibpe = target.getByID(bpe.getUri());
153                        if (ibpe != null && ibpe.equals(bpe))
154                        /* - ibpe.equals(bpe) can be 'false' here, because, 
155                         * even though the above !target.contains(bpe) is true,
156                         * it probably compared objects using '==' operator
157                         * (see the ModelImpl for details)
158                         */
159                        {
160                                updateObjectFields(bpe, ibpe, target);
161                                // We have a merged element, add it into the tracker
162                                mergedElements.add(ibpe);
163                        }
164                        else
165                        {
166                                target.add(bpe);
167                                this.addIntoEquivalanceMap(bpe);
168                                traverser.traverse(bpe, target);
169                                // We have a new element, add it into the tracker
170                                addedElements.add(bpe);
171                        }
172                }
173        }
174
175        /**
176         * Searches the target model for an identical of given BioPAX element, and returns this element if
177         * it finds it.
178         *
179         * @param bpe BioPAX element for which equivalent will be searched in target.
180         * @return the BioPAX element that is found in target model, if there is none it returns null
181         */
182        private BioPAXElement getIdentical(BioPAXElement bpe)
183        {
184                int key = bpe.hashCode();
185                List<BioPAXElement> list = equivalenceMap.get(key);
186                if (list != null)
187                {
188                        for (BioPAXElement other : list)
189                        {
190                                if (other.equals(bpe))
191                                {
192                                        return other;
193                                }
194                        }
195                }
196                return null;
197        }
198
199        /**
200         * Updates each value of <em>existing</em> element, using the value(s) of <em>update</em>.
201         *
202         * @param update   BioPAX element of which values are used for update
203         * @param existing BioPAX element to be updated
204         * @param target
205         */
206        private void updateObjectFields(BioPAXElement update,
207                                        BioPAXElement existing, Model target)
208        {
209                Set<PropertyEditor> editors =
210                                map.getEditorsOf(update);
211                for (PropertyEditor editor : editors)
212                {
213                        updateObjectFieldsForEditor(editor, update, existing, target);
214                }
215
216//              if (!update.getUri().equals(existing.getUri()))
217//              {
218//TODO addNew a unification xref
219//                      if(existing instanceof XReferrable)
220//                      {
221//                              ((XReferrable) existing).addXref(fa);
222//                      }
223//              }
224        }
225
226        /**
227         * Updates the value of <em>existing</em> element, using the value of <em>update</em>.
228         * Editor is used for the modification.
229         *
230         * @param editor   editor for the specific value to be updated
231         * @param update   BioPAX element of which value is used for the update
232         * @param existing BioPAX element to be updated
233         * @param target
234         */
235        private void updateObjectFieldsForEditor(PropertyEditor editor,
236                                                 BioPAXElement update,
237                                                 BioPAXElement existing,
238                                                 Model target)
239        {
240                if (editor.isMultipleCardinality())
241                {
242                        for (Object updateValue : editor.getValueFromBean(update))
243                        {
244                                updateField(editor, updateValue, existing, target);
245                        }
246                }
247                else
248                {
249                        Set existingValue = editor.getValueFromBean(existing);
250                        Set updateValue = editor.getValueFromBean(update);
251                        if (editor.isUnknown(existingValue))
252                        {
253                                if (!editor.isUnknown(updateValue))
254                                {
255                                        updateField(editor, updateValue.iterator().next(), existing, target);
256                                }
257                        }
258                        else {
259                                if (!existingValue.equals(updateValue))
260                                        log.info("Keep existing single cardinality property value: " +
261                                                existingValue + " (ignore: " + updateValue + ")" );
262                        }
263                }
264        }
265
266        /**
267         * Updates <em>existing</em>, using the <em>updateValue</em> by the editor.
268         *
269         * @param editor      editor for the specific value to be updated
270         * @param updateValue the value for the update
271         * @param existing    BioPAX element to be updated
272         * @param target
273         */
274        private void updateField(PropertyEditor editor, Object updateValue,
275                                 BioPAXElement existing, Model target)
276        {
277                if (updateValue instanceof BioPAXElement)
278                {
279                        BioPAXElement bpe = (BioPAXElement) updateValue;
280                        //Now there are two possibilities
281
282
283                        BioPAXElement ibpe = target.getByID(bpe.getUri());
284                        //1. has an identical in the target
285                        if (ibpe != null)
286                        {
287                                updateValue = ibpe;
288                        }
289                        //2. it has no identical in the target
290                        //I do not have to do anything as it will eventually
291                        //be moved.
292
293                }
294                editor.setValueToBean(updateValue, existing);
295        }
296
297        /**
298         * Adds a BioPAX element into the equivalence map.
299         *
300         * @param bpe BioPAX element to be added into the map.
301         */
302        private void addIntoEquivalanceMap(BioPAXElement bpe)
303        {
304                int key = bpe.hashCode();
305                List<BioPAXElement> list = equivalenceMap.get(key);
306                if (list == null)
307                {
308                        list = new ArrayList<BioPAXElement>();
309                        equivalenceMap.put(key, list);
310                }
311                list.add(bpe);
312        }
313}
